name: Sensitive
description:
WELCOME TO SENSITIVE!

Sensitive is a game developed by Oliva Kirwa in 1990~1991 for the Commador 64 (C64), its a 2D puzzle game where the objective is to clear all tiles on each stage, with 60+ levels to beat, its all about endurance and patience.

Built on RPG Maker MV engine, I plan on recreating those memories along with adding my own content to spice things up a bit, here's what to expect.

  • Fully fleshed out, original levels from the actual game
  • Hub world to track progress and to save, along with new features
  • Changeable speeds, lives count, shapes and even change colour
  • A Mini tutorial for the newbies
  • Challenges and Achievements
  • Multiplayer
  • A New Game+ Feature which changes the original stages to something more, chaotic
  • Epic boss battles
  • And more.

Known issues/Work arounds!:

Animation: Some yellow tiles are meant to animated, due to how RPG Maker MV works with its animation, this can be taxing on processing power, therefore, all known animated tiles are now Red.

Tile Explosion: In the original, tiles exploded and looking how it animates looked far more complicated to replicate, instead, tiles phase out, which feels more satisfying to watch.

Shadows: Coloured tiles in the original had shadows, and disappear when they are removed, unfortunately, I have no way of making shadows appear/disappear with "EVENT" scripts, although terrain tiles are pretty simple to do.
